hr.fer.zemris.java.cstr

Class CString

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.cstr.CString

  • public class CString
extends java.lang.Object
    Class offers similar functionality as the old official implementation of the String class: it represents unmodifiable strings on which substring methods (and similar) are executed in O(1) complexity, which is achieved by sharing the character array.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Stjepan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CString(char[] data)
      Allocates a new CString so that it represents the sequence of characters currently contained in the character array argument.
      CString(char[] data, int offset, int length)
      Allocates a new CString that contains characters from a subarray of the character array argument.
      CString(CString original)
      Initializes a newly created CString object so that it represents the same sequence of characters as the argument.

      int hashCode() 
      int indexOf(char c)
      Returns index of first occurrence of char, if char don't exist returns -1
      CString left(int n)
      Returns new CString which represents starting part of original string and is of length n; throw an exception if this can not be constructed; n greater or equal to 0 It is based on substring(int, int) method.
      int length()
      Returns the length of this cstring.
      CString replaceAll(char oldChar, char newChar)
      Creates a new CString in which each occurrence of old character is replaces with new character
      CString replaceAll(CString oldStr, CString newStr)
      Creates a new CString in which each occurrence of old substring is replaces with the new substring

      Returns new CString which represents ending part of original string and is of length n.
      boolean startsWith(CString s)
      Returns true if this string begins with given string, false otherwise.
      CString substring(int startIndex, int endIndex)
      Returns new CString which represents a part of original string; position endIndex does not belong to the substring; it holds: startIndex greater or equal to 0, endIndex greater or equal to startIndex; its complexity is O(1)
      char[] toCharArray()
      Allocates a new array of length equals to length of this CString object (not its internal array ), copies string content into it and returns it.
      java.lang.String toString()
      used for conversion of CString into String

    • Constructor Detail

      • CString

        public CString(char[] data,
               int offset,
               int length)
        Allocates a new CString that contains characters from a subarray of the character array argument. The offset argument is the index of the first character of the subarray and the count argument specifies the length of the subarray. The contents of the subarray are copied; subsequent modification of the character array does not affect the newly created string. If offset and length is zero, empty CString is created
        Parameters:
        data - source of characters to copy
        offset - where to begin
        length - how many characters to copy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if offset or length less than zero, or offset plus length is greater than length of character array from argument.

      • CString

        public CString(char[] data)
        Allocates a new CString so that it represents the sequence of characters currently contained in the character array argument. The contents of the character array are copied. Subsequent modification of the character array does not affect the newly created string.
        Parameters:
        data - source of characters to copy

      • CString

        public CString(CString original)
        Initializes a newly created CString object so that it represents the same sequence of characters as the argument. In other words, the newly created string is a copy of the argument string.
        Parameters:
        original - CString object to copy

    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public static CString fromString(java.lang.String s)
        Returns new CString object which has the same character data as given String object.
        Parameters:
        s - String to take characters from
        Returns:
        new CString matching String from argument

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of this cstring. The length is equal to the number of Unicode code units in the string.
        Returns:
        length of CStrin

      • charAt

        public char charAt(int index)
        Returns the char value at the specified index. An index ranges from 0 to length() - 1. The first char value of the sequence is at index 0, the next at index 1, and so on, as for array indexing.
        Parameters:
        index - index of character to return
        Returns:
        character at index from argument
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index argument is negative or not less than the length of this string.

      • toCharArray

        public char[] toCharArray()
        Allocates a new array of length equals to length of this CString object (not its internal array ), copies string content into it and returns it.
        Returns:
        string content

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        used for conversion of CString into String
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String value of CString object

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(char c)
        Returns index of first occurrence of char, if char don't exist returns -1
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(CString s)
        Returns true if this string begins with given string, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        s - prefix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the substring of this object, false otherwise.

      • endsWith

        public boolean endsWith(CString s)
        Returns true if this string ends with given string, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        s - sufix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a sufix of the substring of this object, false otherwise.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(CString s)
        Returns true if this string contains given string at any position, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        s - CString to find
        Returns:
        true if string from argument is present, false otherwise

      • substring

        public CString substring(int startIndex,
                         int endIndex)
        Returns new CString which represents a part of original string; position endIndex does not belong to the substring; it holds: startIndex greater or equal to 0, endIndex greater or equal to startIndex; its complexity is O(1)
        Parameters:
        startIndex - index to begin with
        endIndex - index to end with
        Returns:
        new CString (part of original string)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if cannot hold index

      • left

        public CString left(int n)
        Returns new CString which represents starting part of original string and is of length n; throw an exception if this can not be constructed; n greater or equal to 0 It is based on substring(int, int) method.
        Parameters:
        n - how many characters to take (from begin)
        Returns:
        CString object with n characters copied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is less than zero

      • right

        public CString right(int n)
        Returns new CString which represents ending part of original string and is of length n. It is based on substring(int, int) method.
        Parameters:
        n - how many characters to copy
        Returns:
        new CString, ending part of original string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this can not be constructed, n must be greater or equal to 0

      • add

        public CString add(CString s)
        Creates a new CString which is concatenation of current and given string
        Parameters:
        s - string to concatenate
        Returns:
        concatenated CString object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null

                          char newChar)
        Creates a new CString in which each occurrence of old character is replaces with new character
        Parameters:

        newChar - the new character
        Returns:

      • replaceAll

        public CString replaceAll(CString oldStr,
                          CString newStr)
        Creates a new CString in which each occurrence of old substring is replaces with the new substring
        Parameters:
        oldStr - the old string
        newStr - the new string
        Returns:
        replaced string
        Throws:
